subject: Law
title: The Civil Rights Act of 1964
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Civil Rights Act of 1964.

hook.text: A Black man sits at a whites-only lunch counter. He's arrested. The Civil Rights Act made that arrest illegal.

buildup.text: The Civil Rights Act of 1964 banned discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

discovery.text: Title II ended segregation in public places. Title VII prohibited employment discrimination. Both transformed America.

twist.text: Congress used the Commerce Clause to pass it‚Äîbecause Southern states argued civil rights weren't a federal matter.

climax.text: It took a century after the Civil War to pass. The law was the product of decades of activism and sacrifice.

punchline.text: One law didn't end discrimination. But it made discrimination illegal.

quiz.question: What did Title VII of the Civil Rights Act prohibit?
